pageContext.claim: “I brought back 650,000 [manufacturing] jobs. … And now Sleepy Joe is saying that, no, no, no, I'm going to bring back -- he's not going to bring back anything.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, as usual, inflates his numbers.  Before the coronavirus, manufacturers had added about 500,000 jobs since Trump took office. But manufacturing jobs growth had slumped badly in 2019, adding only 46,000 jobs during the year. U.S. manufacturing was in a mild recession for all of 2019, according to data released by the Federal Reserve. As for Bidn, a core part of his platform --Build Back Better -- is to bring back manufacturing jobs.
